title: Great Hurricane of 1780
summary: The Great Hurricane of 1780, also known as Hurac√°n San Calixto, the Great Hurricane of the Antilles, the Great Hurricane of the West Indies, and the 1780 Disaster,[1][2] was the deadliest Atlantic hurricane on record, Only behind the 1970 Bhola cyclone. An estimated  22,000 people died throughout the Lesser Antilles when the storm passed through the islands from October 10 to October 16.[3] Specifics on the hurricane's track and strength are unknown, as the official Atlantic hurricane database only goes back to 1851.[4]
